item.title: Big Island in a Day: Volcanoes Waterfalls Sightseeing and History
item.description: The Big Island of Hawaii has a diverse ecosystem unlike anywhere else on the planet, and on this day-long nature tour, experience the beauty of its black-sand beaches, thundering waterfalls, and Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. If you’re lucky, find Hawaiian green sea turtles basking on the coast. Since the tour only requires a moderate amount of walking, it's an educational adventure for travelers of all ages, with snacks and refreshments included.

image.alt: Big Island in a Day: Volcanoes Waterfalls Sightseeing and History

item.title: Big Island Manta Ray Night Snorkel
item.description: Have a unique Big Island experience snorkeling with manta rays on this tour. Led by a local guide, you’ll take a short cruise out to the manta site, where you’ll watch the beautiful Hawaiian before dipping into the water to watch the manta rays up close. All necessary equipment will be provided for your excursion, as well as light refreshments and snacks to enjoy on board. Your tour will conclude at its original departure point. If you don't see manta rays on this excursion, book again for another night--no charge.

image.alt: Big Island Manta Ray Night Snorkel

item.title: Manta Ray Night Snorkel in Keauhou Kona Hawaii
item.description: Have the opportunity to admire wild manta rays in their natural habitat on this evening cruise. A 3 - minute boat ride after dark, when the manta rays come out to feed on plankton, and use a custom-made lightboard with 144,00 lm that attracts the rays. Float through the warm waters to watch as the rays swim and feed, and learn more about the majestic creatures from your guide.

image.alt: Manta Ray Night Snorkel in Keauhou Kona Hawaii

item.title: Captain Cook Snorkel On A Power Catamaran With Lunch
item.description: There are few places in all of Hawaii more historic than Kealakekua Bay, as it's the spot where Captain Cook was killed in a skirmish with native Hawaiians, and the Hawaiian monarch, King Kamehameha III was born just a few miles away. The history aside, it's also one of the best places to snorkel on the Big Island of Hawaii, and you'll have the chance to experience the beauty on this snorkeling tour from Kona. Search for dolphins on the way to the bay while admiring the volcanic coast, and after scouring the red for coral and fish, climb aboard for a lunch that's served by the friendly crew.

image.alt: Captain Cook Snorkel On A Power Catamaran With Lunch

item.title: Manta Ray Night Snorkel - Experienced swimmers only
item.description: Snorkel with placid manta rays at night on this 50-minutes evening tour from Kona. With the proper instruction from a guide and a boat ride to the location where the rays hang out at night, this activity is safe and easy. You'll be provided with snorkel equipment and learn all about the rays' biology and behavior through guided commentary.

image.alt: Manta Ray Night Snorkel - Experienced swimmers only

item.title: Hilo Shore Excursion: Volcanoes National Park, Rainbow Falls
item.description: Sample a cross-section of outdoor sights on the Big Island during this shore excursion exploring Volcanoes National Park, waterfall, black sand beach and more. Discover the postcard-perfect Rainbow Falls before visiting the amazing volcanic steam vents and unique geology around Kilauea Volcano. Before your day is done, check out an ornamental Japanese garden, snack on treats at a local candy shop, and visit a gorgeous black sand beach. A guide, park entrance fees, and round-trip port transport are included.

image.alt: Hilo Shore Excursion: Volcanoes National Park, Rainbow Falls

item.title: Small Group Big Island Twilight Volcano and Stargazing Tour
item.description: Pack in some of Hawaii’s most mesmerizing sights during this Big Island twilight volcano tour. Sample Kona-grown coffee from a local coffee farm, keep an eye out for sea turtles at Punalu'u Black Sand Beach, and taste Hawaiian sweet bread at Punalu’u Bakery. Then, explore Volcanoes National Park before ending your experience by stargazing in a secluded location—perfect for taking in views of the night sky.

image.alt: Small Group Big Island Twilight Volcano and Stargazing Tour

item.title: Mauna Kea Summit and Stars Small-Group Adventure Tour
item.description: Experience big skies and incredible nighttime views on this Mauna Kea stargazing trip with a small group. Experience a warm pre-trip picnic, proceeded by a ride in a 4x4 luxury van to the summit of the Big Island's tallest peak. After admiring a sunset view, continue down to 9,000 feet (2,743 meters) for a stargazing session, complete with a telescope, hot chocolate, and dessert. The trip also includes a guide and a hooded parka to keep you warm.

image.alt: Mauna Kea Summit and Stars Small-Group Adventure Tour

item.title: Mauna Kea Summit Sunset and Stars - Hilo Kona Waikoloa Pick Up
item.description: Enjoy a sunset and stargazing experience like no other on this small-group trip to Mauna Kea—the highest point in the Hawaiian islands. Following afternoon pickup, travel in a 4x4 van to the summit—you can change into a warm jacket and pair of gloves, and sip a hot beverage, as the sun starts to set. Then, learn why so many research telescopes are located here during a brilliant celestial show.

image.alt: Mauna Kea Summit Sunset and Stars - Hilo Kona Waikoloa Pick Up

item.title: Manta Ray Night Snorkel at Kona, Big Island
item.description: After dark is an excellent time to see manta rays in the waters around the Island of Hawaii. Make the most of your opportunity by joining this boat tour led by a guide who knows the area well. Enjoy watching the manta rays feeding at night and snorkeling close to them.

image.alt: Manta Ray Night Snorkel at Kona, Big Island

item.title: Manta Ray Night Snorkel
item.description: Swim with giant manta rays in their nighttime habitat during this 2.5-hour activity in Kona. Travel out into the seas offshore to watch the colorful Kona sunset, then jump in to swim with the docile rays as they feed on microscopic plankton. Follow your guides around the manta habitat and watch as the animals are attracted to the bright lights, creating a "manta rave" of lights, bubbles and mantas. All snorkel equipment, including flotation devices and wet suits, is included. Manta sightings are guaranteed, or you will be given a voucher for another tour.

image.alt: Manta Ray Night Snorkel

item.title: Historical Dinner Cruise to Kealakekua Bay
item.description: Journey back in time — when ancient, powerful Kings ruled the rugged, fertile land of the Hawaiian Islands — on this 3-hour dinner cruise to Kealakekua Bay. Travel 12 miles down the Kona Coast to the Captain Cook monument. Learn the many secrets of the Big Island as a local historian points out more than 50 points of interest along the way.

image.alt: Historical Dinner Cruise to Kealakekua Bay

item.title: Kona's Magical Manta Ray Night Snorkel: Small-Group Eco-Tour
item.description: Get up close with Hawaii’s graceful manta rays during this nighttime snorkel experience along the Kona coast with a small group. Watch these gentle giants as they swoop and dive for plankton just below the surface during their evening feeding. An on-board manta ray specialist, along with a certified swim guide, ensure an informative and safe experience.

image.alt: Kona's Magical Manta Ray Night Snorkel: Small-Group Eco-Tour

item.title: Big Island Highlights: Coffee, Volcano, Black Sands & Waterfall
item.description: Spend a full day exploring the Big Island with visits to waterfalls, beaches, tropical valleys, stunning viewpoints, and so much more. Learn about Kona’s coffee culture with a visit to Greenwell Coffee Farm, for an insider's perspective and to sample the locally cultivated coffee. See Hawaii’s natural beauty at Punalu’u Black Sands Beach, where you can look out for Hawaiian green sea turtles, make multiple stops in Volcanoes National Park, and soak up the beauty of Rainbow Falls all in a day.

image.alt: Big Island Highlights: Coffee, Volcano, Black Sands & Waterfall

item.title: Kealakekua Bay Adventure: Kona Dolphin, Sea Cave and Captain Cook
item.description: Explore the waters off the Big Island on this exciting combo tour. Get your adrenaline pumping as you cruise out and along the coastline on a speedboat. Look for caves, cliffs, whales, dolphins and other marine life along the way. Afterwards, jump into the clear waters and explore the underwater world as you snorkel around. Snacks, drinks and snorkel equipment are all included.

image.alt: Kealakekua Bay Adventure: Kona Dolphin, Sea Cave and Captain Cook

item.title: 9-Line Waterfall Zipline Experience on the Big Island
item.description: See the Big Island from a different angle on this 9-line zipline adventure that takes you over tree tops, waterfalls, and rivers. With four dual lines, you can even race a friend. With views of the Pacific Ocean from every platform, it’s the most scenic zipline experience on the island.

image.alt: 9-Line Waterfall Zipline Experience on the Big Island

item.title: Mauna Kea Summit Tour with Free Night Star Photo
item.description: The 13,803-foot (4,207.3-meter) peak of Mauna Kea is Hawaii's highest point, and a popular spot for star-gazing. With this tour, travel up to the summit with your guide, stop for dinner at the Onizuka Astronomy Complex, then arrive at the summit in time to watch the sunset. As dark sets in, enjoy a guided stargazing experience and marvel at the stars and planets using a refractor telescope and razor pointer.

image.alt: Mauna Kea Summit Tour with Free Night Star Photo

item.title: Big Island Zipline over KoleKole Falls
item.description:
The city of Hilo is surrounded by some of Hawaii’s most scenic wonders—on this 7-line Hilo ziplining tour you'll start off small and gradually increase in length and height per zipline. Soar past thundering falls as you zip through lush greenery. Learn about traditional Hawaiian agriculture, and once you’re comfortable sitting in the harness and feeling the exhilarating rush, prepare for the dramatic crossing that’s one of the longest zipline in Hawaii.
Important tip, for this experience travelers must be between 70 pounds and 260 pounds.

image.alt: Big Island Zipline over KoleKole Falls

item.title: Morning Kealakekua Snorkel Tour
item.description: Casually cruise the Kona coastline and snorkel with tropical marine life, as you splash in the waters of Kealakekua Bay on this deluxe Kona snorkeling cruise. Snorkeling equipment is provided on board, and professional instruction makes this Big Island snorkeling cruise a fun-filled family adventure. On the cruise between shore and the snorkeling site, keep your eyes peeled for spinner dolphins, turtles or even manta rays, and enjoy views of volcanic formations along the Kona coast.

image.alt: Morning Kealakekua Snorkel Tour

item.title: Deluxe Snorkel & Dolphin Watch Aboard a Luxury Catamaran from Kailua-Kona
item.description: Discover Kona’s underwater paradise on this snorkeling cruise and dolphin watch. Cruise through protected marine sanctuaries, home to hundreds of species of enchanting ocean wildlife. After a safety briefing, jump in the water for a snorkel, then relax with a cocktail from the premium cash bar and enjoy the timeless beauty of the Kona coastline on the return trip.

image.alt: Deluxe Snorkel & Dolphin Watch Aboard a Luxury Catamaran from Kailua-Kona

item.title: Manta Ray Night Snorkel in Kona
item.description: Swim alongside manta rays and under the moonlight on this night snorkel tour in Kona. A boat with an eco-friendly engine takes you out to the snorkeling location, where you can descend into the water on a step ladder or choose to stay dry on on board. Extra amenities such as a warm shower, snacks, and beverages make this tour as comfortable as it is memorable.

image.alt: Manta Ray Night Snorkel in Kona

item.title: Big Island Zipline Adventure
item.description: Soar through a Hawaiian rainforest with a zipline experience in a lushly preserved setting. Enjoy the security of the Big Island’s longest-operating zipline destination, and follow a series of eight exciting ziplines from tree to tree. Travel through the jungle with knowledgeable guides, and learn about the plants and animals that thrive in this unique environment. After finishing the zipline experience, explore the scenic property at your own pace, from the delicate Kamaee Falls to a rainforest trail and living maze.

image.alt: Big Island Zipline Adventure

item.title: Sunset and Manta Ray Snorkel Adventure
item.description: Combine two must-do experiences to enhance your vacation in Hawaii. First, board a spacious catamaran for a sunset cruise along the Kona coast. Then slip into the ocean for a snorkel adventure with manta rays. Guides provide instruction and ensure your comfort—you're also guaranteed a manta ray sighting, or your next booking is free.

image.alt: Sunset and Manta Ray Snorkel Adventure

item.title: Big Island Kohala Canopy Zipline Adventure
item.description: Fly across the lush forest of the Big Island’s northern Kohala region on a zipline adventure near Kapaau. Trek through the treetops in a canopy park featuring a series of suspension bridges, platforms, and thrilling ziplines. Expert instructors are on-hand to ensure everyone’s safety while cruising across the customizable, whisper-quiet course.

image.alt: Big Island Kohala Canopy Zipline Adventure
